title: Influences of Z = 100 and N = 152 deformed shells on K <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="inline-block"><msup><mi>K</mi><mi>π</mi></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>8</mn><mo>−</mo></msup></math> isomers and rotational bands in N = 150 isotones
speaker: 吕明熹
paperTitle: Influences of Z = 100 and N = 152 deformed shells on K <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="inline-block"><msup><mi>K</mi><mi>π</mi></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>8</mn><mo>−</mo></msup></math> isomers and rotational bands in N = 150 isotones
paperAbstract: The <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="inline-block"><msup><mi>K</mi><mi>π</mi></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>8</mn><mo>−</mo></msup></math> isomeric states and rotational bands in the even-even 𝑁=150 isotones with 94⩽𝑍⩽104 are investigated by the cranked shell model (CSM) with pairing correlations treated by the particle-number-conserving (PNC) method. The experimental band-head energies and kinematic moments of inertia (MOIs) are reproduced quite well by the PNC-CSM calculation. The two-neutron state with configuration <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="inline-block"><mi>ν</mi><mn>9</mn><mrow><mo>/</mo></mrow><msup><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mn>734</mn><mo stretchy="false">]</mo><mo>⊗</mo><mi>ν</mi><mn>7</mn><mrow><mo>/</mo></mrow><msup><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mn>624</mn><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></math> is the lowest 8− state for these isomers.
